title: Mindy Kaling 'singled out from Office friends' in fight to defend work
text:
Mindy Kaling has alleged that she faced sexism and racism from the Emmys bosses (Picture: Getty Images)

Mindy Kaling has alleged that she faced sexism and racism from the Emmys bosses during her time on The Office.

The comedian was a writer on the hit comedy show from day one and also played Kelly Kapoor, but she has claimed that after she became a producer in the third season – the first women of colour on the producing team – the Television Academy told her there were too many names on the nomination list and so they would be cutting hr.

‘They made me, not any of the other producers, fill out a whole form and write an essay about all my contributions as a writer and a producer,’ the actress said of the 2007 awards show.

‘I had to get letters from all the other male, white producers saying that I had contributed when my actual record stood for itself.’

There were 11 others named on the shortlist alongside Kaling, including two women.

The show did not win that year, losing to 30 Rock.

Mindy Kaling at the 2007 Emmys (Picture: Getty Images)

Mindy created The Mindy Project and Champions and is thought to be working on a ‘coming-of-age’ series with Lang Fisher – known for her work on Brooklyn Nine Nine – inspired by Mindy’s own childhood and the ‘complicated life of a modern-day first-generation Indian American teenage girl’.

Speaking to ELLE for their new Women in Hollywood issue, she added: ‘It really doesn’t matter how much money I have. I’m treated badly with enough regularity that it keeps me humble.

‘I am grateful, because I do think it keeps me feeling like an outsider, which is helpful as a writer,’ she added.

Metro.co.uk has contacted the Television Academy for comment.
